com.groupA.location.world

Class MapManagerFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • com.groupA.location.world.MapManagerFragment

  • public class MapManagerFragment
extends Fragment
    Loads up the map from Google Maps, displays it, moves it as required. Associated with the layout file map_manager.xml.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  MapManagerFragment.MapManagerListener
      The activity that deals with the manager -- that is, MainActivity -- must implement the following functions:

    • Field Detail

      • mZoomLevel

        public int mZoomLevel
        The zoom level. Max = 20.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapManagerFragment

        public MapManagerFragment()

    • Method Detail

      • map_available

        public boolean map_available()
        Is the map available?

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        If the app is being resumed, set up the map again if necessary.

      • onCreateView

        public View onCreateView(LayoutInflater inflater,
                ViewGroup container,
                Bundle savedInstanceState)
        This function gets called when the fragment is set up by the function setUpUI() in MainActivity.java. It loads the xml layout file and assigns mMap to the google map declared in the layout (unless the app is being restored after a rotation or so on, in which case it recovers it from the saved instance state).

      • goToPosition

        public void goToPosition(Location location)
        Moves the map to the location given as a parameter. The zoom level is given by the variable mZoomLevel.
        Parameters:
        location - The location to which we must move the map.

      • zoomToStandardLevel

        public void zoomToStandardLevel()
        Return the zoom level of the map at the standard level

      • onAttach

        public void onAttach(Activity activity)
        This gets called when the class is instantiated. It checks that the main activity implements the interface MapManagerListener; and if so, it stores that implementation in mListener (to be able to invoke it if necessary). Otherwise, it raises an exception.

      • updateGraphics

        public void updateGraphics()
        Update the map graphics, drawing beacons, targets and players

      • drawBeacons

        public void drawBeacons()
        Draw all the beacons

      • drawTargets

        public void drawTargets()
        Draw all the targets

      • drawOthers

        public void drawOthers()
        Draw all players

      • drawCharacter

        public void drawCharacter(PlayerCharacter p)
        Draw a given character
        Parameters:
        p - the character to draw

      • drawBeacon

        public void drawBeacon(Beacon b)
        Draw a given beacon
        Parameters:
        b - the beacon

      • drawTarget

        public void drawTarget(LatLng pos)
        Draw a given target
        Parameters:
        pos - the target's position

        public boolean onMarkerClick(Marker marker)
